go_data.justification: PD-L1 was one of only 4 proteins reproducibly decreased more than two-fold from the plasma membrane.
The success of anti-cancer therapies targeting the PD-1/PD-L1 immune checkpoint lies in their ability to potentiate anti-tumour immunity.
Deleting PD-L1 or adding a saturating concentration of PD-1 blocking antibody to the co-culture enhanced T-cell activation.
CMTM6 was immunoprecipitated from digitonin lysates of IFN-gamma treated cells and subjected to mass spectrometry analysis, identifying PD-L1 as a high confidence interacting protein.
